body.p: In reaching its conclusions, the Board noted that the situation in which two or more investors (individually or as a group) have decision‑making rights over different activities of an investee that significantly affect the investee’s returns is not expected to arise frequently. This is because one party or body usually has overall decision‑making responsibility for an investee (see paragraph BC85). The Board believes that its conclusions in this respect will ensure that it does not create an incentive to structure investees to achieve an accounting outcome by involving multiple parties in decision‑making when there is no business rationale to do so.
